title: Locations of Interest
content:
[[include :scp-wiki:theme:paperstack]]
[[include :scp-wiki:component:toggle-sidebar]]

[[module CSS]]
@media (min-width: 768px) {
    #main-content { max-width: min(900px, calc(100% - 4rem)); }
}
:root {
  --header-subtitle: "Locations of Interest";
  --sp_header-subtitle-scale: 2.125;
}
#header h1 a::before, #header h2 span::before {
    font-family: 'Sans Normalcy', 'Nanum Gothic', 'Arial', sans-serif;
}

body {
    background-image: linear-gradient(
        to bottom,
        #FCFCFC, #FCFCFC 100%);
}

div#extra-div-1 {
    height: 140px;
    width: 100%;
    top: 28px;
    position: absolute;
    background: url("https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/sigma-9-themes/SCP_F.png");
    background-size: contain;
    background-repeat: no-repeat;
    background-position: calc(50vw - 380px) 50%;
    z-index: -1;
}
@media (max-width: 767px) {
    div#extra-div-1 {
         opacity: 0.2;
         background-position: 50% 50%;
    }
}

.socontent.header h1 {
    font-size: 1.85rem;
    max-width: max-content;
    margin: 2.5rem auto 1rem;
}
.socontent.header h1 span {
    padding: 0 .25em;
    text-transform: uppercase;
}

blockquote,
div.blockquote,
#toc,
.code {
    background-color: var(--paper-background-color);
    border: solid .05rem var(--paper-block-color);
    box-shadow: 0 0 .25rem var(--paper-shadow-color);
}

.legend-grid {
    display: grid;
    grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fill, minmax(min(90px, 100%), 1fr));
    grid-gap: 10px;
    box-sizing: border-box;
}

.legend-box {
    border: 1px solid white; 
}
[[/module]]

[!-- Author Information --]

[[include :scp-wiki:info:start]]
[[=]]
Written by [[*user Jerden]] and [[*user Ralliston]].

A rewrite of the [[[nexus-series|Nexus Hub]]] by [[*user HotCocoaNerd]] and [[*user IronDruid]].

With additional locations based on [http://pseudo-scp-jp.wikidot.com/stray-nexus this Japanese Page] by [[*user dr-kasugai]], [[*user gipolibidemia]], and [[*user stengan774]].

**[[[jerden|Jerden's Author Page]]]**

**[[[ralliston-s-authorpage|Ralliston's Authorpage]]]**
[[/=]]
[[include :scp-wiki:info:end]]

[[div class="blockquote" style="font-size: 106.25%"]]
The Foundation has identified a number of locations around the world (and beyond it) that are actively anomalous and support permanent communities. While these places would generally be given an SCP designation and evacuated, in some cases this is not possible, due to practical or political constraints. Although not all Locations of Interest are fully controlled by the Foundation,  containment measures are in place to ensure that the general public remains unaware of their existence or anomalous nature.

An inhabited anomalous location designated as a Nexus permits residents to remain within it, under the supervision of the Foundation or another Group of Interest, since the anomalous properties of a Nexus generally cannot extend beyond its borders. Additionally, the Foundation has permitted the existence of a number of Free Ports, paranormal enclaves and other locations accessible only through anomalous means, within which the concealment and containment of anomalies is unnecessary. These communities are usually self-managed, with observation from the Foundation and local governments to ensure that anomalous phenomena remain within the Free Port. A number of additional Locations of Interest are known to the Foundation at this time, ranging in scale from small towns to entire countries, as well as entire alternate realities accessible from our own.
[[/div]]

[[# classes]]

+ Area Classes 

As shown on the map above, anomalous locations are given one of the following classifications, based on how obvious their anomalous properties are and how likely civilians from outside the Nexus are to encounter them. For more information on Nexus definitions and properties, see [[[nexus-series| this page]]].

[[f>image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Briar.svg height="80px"]]

[[size 130%]]**##blue|Briar##**[[/size]]

Nexus features extranormal events and anomalous objects at a higher-than-normal rate. These are generally only noticeable to permanent inhabitants, requiring little or no cover-up by the Foundation. 

Name derived from the Briar Patch, from the Br'er Rabbit folktales.
@@ @@

[[f>image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Asphodel.svg height="80px"]]

[[size 130%]]**##green|Asphodel##**[[/size]]

Nexus features a high frequency of extranormal events and anomalous objects. Most visitors will notice that something about this place is unusual, requiring some cover-up by the Foundation. 

Name derived from the Fields of Asphodel, the afterlife in Greek Mythology. 
@@ @@

[[f>image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Camelot.svg height="80px"]]

[[size 130%]]**##FFDD00|Camelot##**[[/size]]

Anomalous activity is an integral part of the town. The Foundation must regularly perform cover-ups, and takes measures to prevent visitors, such as removing the settlement from maps of the area. Containment Facilities may be required on a case-by-case basis. 

Name derived from castle of Camelot, from the legends of King Arthur. 
@@ @@

[[f>image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Shangri-La.svg height="80px"]]

[[size 130%]]**##orange|Shangri-La##**[[/size]]

Frequent and unpredictable anomalous activity, which the Foundation deals with as it occurs. The Foundation actively prevents civilians from entering the area. Containment facility required. 

Name derived from the hidden valley of Shangri-La, from James Hilton's Lost Horizon novel. 
@@ @@

[[f>image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Dunwich.svg height="80px"]]

[[size 130%]]**##red|Dunwich##**[[/size]]

The entire place is anomalous, and almost entirely cut off from the non-anomalous world. Special measures may be required to keep personnel safe. Entry and exit tightly controlled. Containment facility required. 

Name derived from the insular town of Dunwich, from the works of H.P. Lovecraft. 
@@ @@

[[f>image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Free-Port.svg height="80px"]]

[[size 130%]]**##purple|Free Port##**[[/size]]

Hubs of commerce and living, accessible only through anomalous means. These communities are aware of the anomalous, and make use of it in everyday life. These hubs are protected by national or international law, restricting or forbidding Foundation intervention, with law enforcement within the Nexus often performed by its own local government.
@@ @@

[[f>image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Crossroads.svg height="80px"]]

[[size 130%]]**##grey|Crossroads##**[[/size]]

Anomalous location connected to one or more alternate realities in addition to our own reality. These may be alternative timelines that diverged from our own at some point in the past, or entire universes operating under different physical laws to our own. These alternate realities are distinct  from so-called "pocket universes", which are also separated from baseline reality, but are significantly smaller in size.
@@ @@

[[f>image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Turing.svg height="80px"]]

[[size 130%]]**##008888|Turing##**[[/size]]

Anomalous location existing within a computer simulation, rather than in physical space.

Named after the computer scientist and philosopher, Alan Turing.
@@ @@

[[f>image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Location-of-Interest.svg height="80px"]]

[[size 130%]]**Other Locations of Interest**[[/size]]

A number of other inhabited anomalous locations have come to the attention of the Foundation, but are not currently categorised as a Nexus or Free Port, or may have unusual attributes resulting in a non-standard Nexus Class.
@@@@

[[# consensus-reality]]
[[div class="blockquote"]]
++ [[span style="font-family: Verdana; font-size: 125%;"]][[[scp-7243| Nx-00]]]: Consensus Reality (Formerly Nx-7243) [[/span]]

**Area Class:** --##grey|**Ohanna**##-- ##green|**ENTIRE**## (##666|**Crossroads**##)

**Accessible From:** Baseline, Multiverse

**Surveillance Facility:** Outpost-7243

**Description:** The "Prime Universe" or "Nexus-00" designates consensus reality: all that which is observably, measurably extant and compatible with our universe. This includes any other extrauniversal space which is tethered to, or interfaces with, our reality in a coherent fashion. Any region which can successfully be referenced within consensus reality is, itself, an extension of consensus reality, and therefore comprises Nexus-00. Nexus-00 is of course not a single contiguous, continuous physical surface. It incorporates various physically-disconnected locales which are at least informationally-adjacent to consensus reality. However, it has been evidenced to Our Foundation that the manifold of our local universe (Nexus-00-A) also possesses points and/or boundaries of informational discontinuity. These discontinuities are not to be confused with embedded pocket-universes (ie. a black hole's interior), nor [*/scp-3930 regions of non-existence], nor extreme antimemetic influence, nor local breakdown of conventional physics, nor **##green|hazardous nomenclative influence##**; all such regions can still be referenced, however circuitously, within the manifold of Nexus-00.

**Associated Articles:**
* [[[SCP-7243]]] - **##gray|EXISTENTIAL ABATEMENT##**
[[/div]]

[[# wanderers-library]]
[[div class="blockquote"]]
++ [[span style="font-family: Verdana; font-size: 125%;"]][[[scp-6000| Nx-01]]]: [http://wanderers-library.wikidot.com/ The Wanderers' Library] [[/span]]

[[f>image https://wanderers-library.wdfiles.com/local--files/component%3Atheme/wl_logo.png width="150px"]]

**Area Class:** --##red|**Dunwich**##-- ##666|**Crossroads**##

**Description:** This vast extradimensional library allegedly catalogs everything that has ever been written down, containing countless books that cannot be found anywhere else, including many documenting the occult and paranormal. Although the Foundation has been aware of the Library since 1955, it has existed for much longer than that. The Library is also known as the Nexus of Worlds and the Great Library Yggdrasil due to its connection to multiple universes, with a particularly close connection to other anomalous libraries such as [[[SCP-1726]]] and [[[SCP-4001]]]. The Nexus and the books within are maintained and protected by various inhuman entities known as [[[wanderers-library-hub|Librarians]]]. Individuals that harm the Library, its books, or its patrons are punished by transformation into one of these Librarians, serving the Library until they work off their debt. This has been the fate of a number of Foundation personnel during incursions into the Library, and so the Foundation has adopted a more diplomatic approach to this specific location. The Library is reportedly headed by an entity known as [[[divine-dossier#the-serpent| The Serpent]]], and serves as the base of operations for GoI-014 ("[[[serpent-s-hand-hub|The Serpent's Hand]]]"). 

**Associated Articles:**
* [[[wanderers-library-hub|The Wanderer's Library Hub]]]
* [[[yggdrasils-surveyor|Yggdrasil's Surveyor Hub]]]
* [[[Third Law Hub]]]
* [[[another-goddamn-magic-system|Magic Orientation]]]
* [[[Lessons Learned]]]
* [[[secrets-and-their-keepers|Secrets and Their Keepers]]]
* [[[The Black Vaults of Alagadda]]]
* [[[SCP-6000]]] - The Serpent, the Moose, and the Wanderer's Library
* All pages tagged [/system:page-tags/tag/wanderers-library wanderers-library].
[[/div]]

[[# annwn]]
[[div class="blockquote"]]
++ [[span style="font-family: Verdana; font-size: 125%;"]][[[nx-02 |Nx-02]]]: Annwn (Formerly Avalon) [[/span]]

**Area Class:** ##FFDD00|**Camelot**##

**Accessible From:** Irish Sea

**Containment Facility:** [[[secure-facility-dossier-site-12|Site-12]]]

**Description:** Known as Tír na nÓg by the Tuatha Dé Danann (//Homo sapiens tumuli//), and as Avalon by the Fae (//Homo sapiens sidhe//), Annwn is an island located in an extradimensional space. Nx-02 is populated by an unknown number of spectral entities, and is accessible only to those subject to certain [[[SCP-6916| oneirological triggers]]]. Due to growing animosity between the Foundation and the ruler of Nexus, the Foundation's access to the space has now been revoked. Initially believed to have been created and governed by the Fae, recent evidence collated by the Foundation suggests the Nexus was actually originally under human governance, likely Celtic Britons. At some point, between the Roman invasion of Britain, the area was taken over by the Fae and exiled from baseline reality, becoming Nx-02..

**Associated Articles:** 
* [[[SCP-6916]]] - Hiraeth and the Land of My Fathers
* [[[Nx-02]]]
* [[[Finding Avalon]]]
* [[[fae-myths-and-legends|Fae Myths and Legends]]]
[[/div]]

[[# hy-brasil]]
[[div class="blockquote"]]
++ [[span style="font-family: Verdana; font-size: 125%;"]][[[nx-03 |Nx-03]]]: The Kingdom of Hy-Brasil [[/span]]

[[f>image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/art%3Alocations-of-interest/COA-Hy-Brasil.svg width="150px"]]

**Area Class:** --##purple|**Free Port**##-- ##FFDD00|**Camelot**##

**Accessible From:** 100 km west of Ireland

**Surveillance Facility**: Site-03

**Description:** One of the Five Fae Kingdoms, Known as Tír na nÓg, The Kingdom of Hy Brasil is a magical island nation state located on an island in the Atlantic Ocean, accessible through non-anomalous means only one day every seven years. The Nexus is governed by the Tuatha Dé Danann (//Homo sapiens tumuli//), an anomalous hominid subspecies native to the island, and acts as a neutral ground for many organisations to operate in, including the Foundation, although the Kingdom is also member of the [[[goc-hub-page| Global Occult Coalition's]]] Council of 108. The island was devastated in 1988 by the arrival of [[[lte-0851-cetus | LTE-0851-Cetus]]] and the subsequent fallout from the GOC's military response.  Both High King Nuada Airgetlám VII and Crown Princess Mór-Ríoghain were killed, and much of the island's surviving population migrated to other Free Ports and paranormal enclaves. The Nexus remains, significantly diminished in power, strength, and population, although reconstruction efforts are ongoing.

**Associated Articles:**

[[# murky-lake]]
[[div class="blockquote"]]
++ [[span style="font-family: Verdana; font-size: 125%;"]]Nx-04: Murky Lake[[/span]]

**Area Class:** ##orange|**Shangri-La**##

**Containment Facility:** Site-107

**Location:** New Mexico, USA

**Description:** Murky Lake is a town that has been abandoned since 1936, before which it was notable for an unusually high rate of disappearances and other anomalous events. In addition to lacking a human population at present, wildlife, chlorophyl, music and many parts of the buildings are absent. A number of intangible humanoid figures have been sighted within the Nexus, but all attempts at communication have failed.

**Associated Articles:** 
* [[[SCP-5352]]] - Absence
[[/div]]

[[# spiral-forest]]
[[div class="blockquote"]]
++ [[span style="font-family: Verdana; font-size: 125%;"]][[[nx-05|Nx-05]]]: The Spiral Forest [[/span]]

**Area Class:** ##green|**EMBLA**##[[footnote]]An anomalous location functions as a esoteric area use to create anomalies.[[/footnote]] (##666|**Crossroads**##)

**Accessible From:** Baseline, Multiverse

**Surveillance Facility:** [[[secure-facilities-locations| Site-01]]]

**Description:** Nx-05 is a large forest located in upstate [REDACTED], nearby Site-01. It is one of the smallest Nexuses on record, being only 8.3 acres of land in total. The area exhibits mild, albeit consistent non-Euclidean activity. This most often manifests in the form of its various hiking paths temporarily being subject to anomalous activity such as going upward endlessly when travelled in a certain direction, but operating normally otherwise. Nx-05 is unique compared to other Nexuses in that no other anomalous phenomena naturally forms in its confines, with all anomalies resulting from it being entirely manmade. Despite its fairly unimpressive features, Nx-05 remains the only location known to the Foundation which can be accurately studied to provide information on how the anomalous as a whole operates; equations derived from this study have provided the basis for the entirety of the Foundation’s understanding of anomalies since the organization's inception.

**Associated Articles:**
* [[[nx-05 |Nx-05]]]
* [[[dr-manns-proposal| Dr. Mann's Proposal]]] - The Spiral Path

The Foundation is collaborating with the peace-seeking Desilist faction to prevent conflict and ensure the Kingdom of Univers'Isle remains concealed.

[[# irkalla]]
[[div class="blockquote"]]
++ [[span style="font-family: Verdana; font-size: 125%;"]]Nx-61: [[[ptt-1666-gray-templum|Irkalla]]][[/span]]

**Area Class:** ##666|**Crossroads**##

**Accessible From:** Zagros mountains of Northern Iraq and Western Iran

**Description:** One of the many afterlives available to humanity, Irkalla, also known as Ir-Kalla, Irkalia, Kukku, Arali, Kigal, Kur or Erṣetu, a vast, partially extraspatial underground cavern below the Middle East, with a single spiral staircase acting as its entrance. This cavern contains many spirits and demons from the collection of societies that once resided in pre-Islamic Mesopotamia, and is one of a number of locations that have been traditionally described as a hell. Is the ancient Babylonian and Sumerian underworld or Sumerian Netherworld. It was a dark, dreary cavern located deep below the ground, where inhabitants were believed to continue "a shadowy version of life on earth". 

Irkalla was host to a large-scale slave revolt and civil war in the latter half of the 20th century, spurred on by competing interests from both America and the Soviet Union. Relations between Irkalla and the United States have eased lately, allowing an embassy and a UIU International Office to be established in its capital, but tensions still remain high. As the Tartarean Realm slowly industrializes and reaches out to the broader occult community, The United States hopes to use it as a pawn in their cold war against the Prince of Darkness, though the current regime is loath to be manipulated.

**Associated Articles:**

[[# elelin]]

**Containment Facility:** Area-41

**Description:** The mythical city of Elelín, known as Ciudad de los Césares, City of Patagonia, The Wandering City, Trapalanda or Trapananda, Lin Lin, Elelín and City of Ceasars. Accessible via numerous Ways within the Patagonia region of South America. SCP-6623 is a two-tiered city, organised into numerous hub areas. The lower tier is mostly residential areas, consisting of typical 17th-century Spanish architecture as well as small farms. Due to the quantity of farms, most replacing typical plazas within buildings, it is assumed much of this city's food source was gained through subsistence farming. The city's upper-tier largely consists of intact governmental buildings, schools, marketplaces, and libraries, in addition to a large central building. This building appears to be the focal piece of the city, dwarfing all other buildings on the upper tier. Member of The Seven Cities of Gold.

[[# mamonokai]]
[[div class="blockquote"]]
++ [[span style="font-family: Verdana; font-size: 125%;"]]Nx-96: Mamonokai (魔物界) [[/span]]

**Area Class:** ##red|**Dunwich**##

**Accessible from:** Japan

**Surveillance Facility:** [[[secure-facilities-locations|Site-50]]]

**Description:** Once known as SCP-6979-1, Mamonokai was a dimensional mirror of Japan, where the Mamono, a type of Yokai entity lived. The Mamono were once formless entities that gained form and names thanks to the folktales of Japan that they inspired, becoming a cycle that fed both the anomalous world of Japan as well as the one in Mamonokai. Following the Meiji Restoration, Mamonokai was invaded and used by the IJAMEA in order to create the Yokai Battalion, the group murdering all opposition and enslaving the remains. Over 90% of Mamonokai’s population was murdered or removed from the area, and the place was left to rot. Following the discovery of the Kuchisake-Onna, Mamonokai was revitalized, and a town was built inside of it for the residence of anomalous entities and the flourishing of an anomalous society that would benefit Site-50 and the Japanese Branch of the Foundation in general, the once destroyed place becoming a Nexus. While some survivors have accepted the move, others still resent the Japanese for crimes committed by the Empire of Japan.

**Associated Articles:**

**Description:** Recognized as one of the more peculiar alternate universes to directly contact baseline reality, the Piss World[[footnote]](Provisional codename; official name pending translation.)[[/footnote]] refers to an anomalous planetary body and biosphere which heavily incorporate a potent substance that, for all intents and purposes, is identical to human urine. Residing here is Species of Interest-9155 ("Bacteranoids") -- gelatinous, metamorphic organisms responsible for creating entire civilizations, economies and cultures all revolving around the liquid that forms their landscape. A former utopia, Nx-933 and its society is suffering from an ecological catastrophe caused by the gradual, inexplicable disappearance of its main fluid, forcing the species' most brilliant minds to search outside the bounds of their universe in hopes of discovering an alternate source of the only liquid that can save them from an impending apocalypse.

The Atlanteans were subsequently granted a small region of land around a reservoir by the US Government, which has been developed into a small but secluded city, concealed through techno-thaumaturgy, but heavily monitored by the United States Military. **Description:** Hong Shing is located in a pocket dimension that connects the city of Hong Kong to Hong Gong, its counterpart in a parallel universe. Hong Shing duplicates the geography of the Hong Kong peninsula and islands, but is surrounded by an impassable barrier, notably used as a canvas by local anartists known as "Sky Wall Painters". Hong Shing is monitored by governments and normalcy organisations from both universes, and the Foundation here in the "Left Phase" has established a working relationship with its counterpart from the "Right Phase", an organisation known as the Zhujihui. Hong Shing is regarded as neutral space between worlds, giving it a high level of autonomy, and allowing the city to serve as a hub for cross-cultural exchange of paratechnology and thaumaturgy. 

While relatively young, it has nonetheless established a presence in the anomalous world as an important global city and the primary Asian Free Port.

**Area Class:** ##purple|**Free Port**##

**Description:** Eurtec, The EURopean Technological Esoteric Capital and The So-called "Capital of the Coalition".[[footnote]]Also known as Homeland GOC codeword for Eurtec.[[/footnote]] Is the prime technological metropolis in the west and an apple of the [[[goc-hub-page|Global Occult Coalition's]]] (GOC)'s eye, being one of the GOC most ambitious projects. The city state and paratechnological enclave was founded by the Servants of the Silicon Nornir.[[footnote]]A member of the GOC's Council of 108.[[/footnote]] Following their addition to the Council of 108.[[footnote]]The servants were part of the Allied Occult Initiative (AOI) 1939-1945, GOC precursor and founding member of the coalition and membership of Council of 108 but the Project EURTEC was only aproved in 1970 by the GOC High Command and the Council of 108, while the founding resources started in 1969.[[/footnote]] In the 1970s in order to speed up the development of paratechnology for the purposes of their own agenda. While relatively young, it has nonetheless established a presence in the anomalous world as an important global city and the primary European Free Port. 

Is where the most advanced technology in the world is developed, dominated by towering skyscrapers, the offices and the paratech research divisions of multiple multinational corporations. It is divided between the upper city and the lower city. The section of the city 600 meters above sea level or higher is officially designated the upper city. The upper city operates as the de facto capital of the Council of 108, and houses both the regional Coalition headquarters and the modern Council Assembly building. The Golden District 1000 meters above sea level housing the city's richest, important and most powerful individuals and organizations in Eurtec. However, beneath Eurtec's advanced technology and shining skyscrapers and highest towers is a Lower City infamous for crime and violence, while this district in the lower city earning it the nickname of the "Blood District"  is notorious for being rife with paracrime.

**Description:** A seaport located in a pocket dimension, said to have once been the fairyland of the Mershark (鲛人), the daughter of Rjok the Ocean-Lord (海若). Later developed in the Ming Dynasty into a haven for Chinese fishermen and merchants. Through thaumaturgical Ways within banks of fog, the Free Port can be accessed from and can grant access to any area of the sea. For this reason, it has historically been contested by various powers in the Far East, including the Lan-Fang Republic and Colonies of the West, but it is now a Free Port under the control of several GoI. At present, the Mazu Faith and other oceans-related beliefs are maintained in this place.

[[# wilheim]]
[[div class="blockquote"]]
++ [[span style="font-family: Verdana; font-size: 125%;"]] FP-11: [[[scp-6268| Wilheim]]][[/span]]

**Area Class:** ##purple|**Open Free Port**##[[footnote]] Anomalous location existing within the baseline. Functions as a Free Port but can be entered through non-anomalous means. [[/footnote]]

**Accessible From:** (Formerly German Empire), Around the Earth

**Description:** The floating city-state of Wilheim the Free port and paranormal enclave was founded when SCP-6268 and their following, likewise-minded sidhe and similar fae subjects, managed to take control of Wilheim, a massive aerial eigenweapon created by the German Empire between 1912 and 1917. The construction of Wilheim was mainly aided and supervised by the [[[magierakademie-hub|Mages Academy]]] (Magickademia Germanica), and was intended to function as a weather-manipulating mobile station, but, due to several installation errors, never saw actual deployment. 

Under the order of SCP-6268, Wilheim was rebuilt as a floating city-state, operating as a self-proclaimed sanctuary for paranormal beings and human subjects affiliated with the anomalous. Following several disputes between SCP-6268, the government of West Germany, the Global Occult Coalition and the Foundation, Wilheim was officially recognized as an allied and independent geopolitical entity in 1977.

[[# meat-market]]
[[div class="blockquote"]]

++ [[span style="font-family: Verdana; font-size: 125%;"]] FP-12: Meat Market [[/span]]

**Area Class:** ##purple|**Free Port**##

**Accessible From:** Bevendean Down Nature Reserve, Brighton, BN2 4LA, United Kingdom

**Description:** Located in a particularly overgrown area of the nature reserve, this very unique market must be sought out by only those who know the chant. You must imagine the market, you must imagine the wares, imagine yourself there — and then offer a sacrifice before you make your wish. As you spin into a new world and land, hopefully on your feet, you realise that a crowded, dusty market surrounds you. Some forms might well be human, but many more forms are clearly not even humanoid — and known earth languages were far from the only ones spoken here. Almost whatever you wish for can be found here, in exchange for meat, preferably removed fresh as the hanging blades and cleavers adorning every market stall. And almost every meat you could ever wish for was also available there, with humans being quite the rarity, as they struggled to recall and retain the chant that let them into a place that sold 'Vincent's (slightly used) Vulvas' and 'Pied Piper's Premie Pies'. Brighton, so far, has the only entrance and exit known to the Meat Market, but is unlikely to truly be the only way in and out — so maybe someone else will stumble across the mystical place beyond the veil too, countries away, and the Meat Market will get something new.

**Accessible From:** Hong Kong, China

**Description:** An expansive extradimensional space, formerly part of the Kowloon Walled City in Hong Kong. The Freeport exists due to the lingering effects of [[[SCP-184]]], which was utilized by an unknown party to significantly expand the internal space of buildings within the Walled City. Although these were thought to have been destroyed by the demolition of the city in 1994, it appears that significant portions survived within a pocket dimension. San Kowloon is a labyrinth of interconnected rooms, corridors and stairwells, and is now entirely controlled by Triads, who have divided up San Kowloon between them, creating twelve districts each one controlled by a organization together the "Twelve Lords of San Kowloon". The Foundation and [[[goc-hub-page| Global Occult Coalition]]] are currently working on finding a way into the paranormal enclave, although all attempts so far have failed.

[[# new-amsterdam]]
[[div class="blockquote"]]

++ [[span style="font-family: Verdana; font-size: 125%;"]] FP-20: New Amsterdam[[/span]]

**Area Class:** ##purple|**Free Port**##

**Accessible From:** Manhattan, New York, USA

**Description:** Named after and accessible from the former Dutch colony in south Manhattan, New Amsterdam is an artificial pocket universe and paranormal enclave established during the Paranormal Renaissance. Created under contract for a group of wealthy New York industrialists and socialites, New Amsterdam was originally founded as a tax haven. While it has since been brought under American jurisdiction by the [[[paralaw|Hoover Mandate]]], New Amsterdam continues to function as an exclusive community for extremely wealthy individuals behind the Veil. 

Some of the oldest and most powerful families known as "Veiled Nobility" and "Veiled Royalty" of the Veiled world (Anomalous World), hail from or reside in New Amsterdam, where they are perfectly positioned to manipulate mundane and paranormal affairs while still being free to openly indulge in anomalous interests and activities. The main New York offices of [[[marshall-carter-and-dark-hub| Marshall, Carter & Dark]]] are located in New Amsterdam, and it is suspected that at least one [[[o5-command-dossier|Foundation Overseer]]] maintains a residence in the enclave.

The Sanctuary, referred to as Toyoho for short or as the Samuto Locality, is inhabited by anomalous entities known as "Yōkai", in addition to a small number of humans, as well as people of mixed human and Yōkai ancestry. Most of the population lives in the town of Samuto, on the eastern shore of the landmass. A southwestern area known as Īhatōv was originally the dreamscape of the Japanese fiction author Kenji Miyazawa, but merged with Samuto following the death of its creator.

**Description:** Also known as City of the Accursed, the anomalous city-state of Ai'gazar-En was founded in 2022 by a group of survivors from Universe-ZL/018b, one of the first universes conquered by Rea Utis-per during the [[[SCP-7023| Crisis]]]. This initial community, led by a man named Sajid Inturmann, faced many hardships due to the inherent anomalies within [[[SCP-8023]]], but they were also able to harness these anomalies and use them to their benefit. Today Ai'gazar-En is permanently inhabited by hundreds to thousands of people at any given time, mostly multiversal refugees, however the exact overall number of citizens has never been counted. The local atmosphere is breathable, albeit with some difficulty, as it contains slightly less oxygen than humans from most universes are accustomed to.

[[# avalon]]
[[div class="blockquote"]]
++ [[span style="font-family: Verdana; font-size: 125%;"]] FP-26: The kingdom of Avalon ("New Avalon")[[/span]]

**Area Class:** --##purple|**Free Port**##-- Neutralized

**Accessible From:** United Kingdom, Europe, Otherworld

**Description:** One of the Five Fae Kingdoms. Once a thriving hub for Fae societies, the Sixth Occult War and the establishment of the Veil led to the significant weakening of the nomenclative narrative spells that held Avalon together. This eventually led to its deconceptualization and disappearance from baseline reality, forcing most of its citizens to seek refuge in Three Portlands, with the help of the British Occult Service. fully deconceptualized in 1907. Although in the modern day, Avalon has been gone for over a century, the [[[finding-avalon|influence of its culture can still be seen throughout most of the paranormal world]]], although reconstruction efforts are ongoing. 

The destruction of Avalon resulted in a cultural and political cleavage amongst the survivors. The majority of the Sídhe, including the royal family, resettled in the Outer Hebrides and established the realm of New Avalon; however, a sizable population of Sídhe, driven by anti-royal sentiment, refused to settle in New Avalon, with most instead opting to reside in FP-01 (Three Portlands). The royalists in New Avalon are known as the Seelie, while the anti-royalists in Three Portlands call themselves the Unseelie.

**Description:** Fernafaun is a large pocket dimension, taking the form of a large, heavily forested island, which is home to a number of small communities, alongside the city and namesake of the Free Port at its centre. Predominantly populated by members of several Fae subspecies, the island is home to a number of anomalous flora and fauna previously thought to be extinct, and several previously undiscovered species.

**Area Class:** ##purple|**Free Port**##

**Accessible From:** Cha Kwo Ling, Hong Kong, China

**Description:** New Cha Ling is a Free Port located inside a pocket dimension, officially classified as part of the Kwun Tong District of Hong Kong, with residents permitted to secretly elect a representative to the City Council. Although originally created as an autonomous squatter settlement, New Cha Ling was discovered by the [http://scp-int.wikidot.com/groups-of-interest-zh#ZT "Zero Team"] of the Royal Hong Kong Police in 1961, and was placed under their jurisdiction. Following the transfer of Hong Kong to the People's Republic of China in 1997, the Zero Team was reorganised into the "Cha Ling Police Station", limiting the scope of their paranormal investigations to within New Cha Ling. Although the population is only around 1,500 people, the pocket dimension serves as a haven for anomalous individuals, including refugees and fugitives from outside Hong Kong.

++ [[span style="font-family: Verdana; font-size: 125%;"]] FP-71: Ireta K'éri[[/span]]
 
**Area Class:** --##purple|**Open Free Port**##-- Neutralized

**Accessible From:** Mexico

**Description:** A former paranormal enclave, this Mexican town defied both drug cartels and government corruption through a revival of ancient traditions and theurgic practices, particularly through tribute to the Purépecha sun deitiy Curicaueri. The success of the town forced both the Mexican government and the Foundation to recognize its autonomy as a Paranormal Free Port. However, this recognition was short-lived, as Ireta K'éri was subsequently destroyed. 
 
Reporting by the Fifth [[[wandsmen-hub|Wandsman]]] of Elysium exposed a Mexican government conspiracy to hire the [[[valravn-corporation-hub|Valravn Corporation]]] to destroy Ireta K'éri and massacre its residents. The Foundation was suspected of involvement in the plot, [[[A Wandsman in the Navel of the Moon| but no evidence was found to support this allegation]]]. Some of the surviving members of the Ireta K'éri community moved to FP-72, the miniature town of [[[SCP-7269|Ireta Sapi]]], although reconstruction efforts are ongoing.

**Accessible From:** Michoacán, Mexico

**Description:** [[[SCP-7269]]] designates as an anomalous 30 x 30 x 30 meter area located near Pátzcuaro, Michoacán. Humans, vertebrate animals, and human-made objects will shrink gradually upon entering the area, and grow back to their original size when exiting it. Taking advantage of this property, Las Viboras, a left-wing guerrilla group with connections to the [[[serpent-s-hand-hub|the Serpent's Hand]]], built a miniature town inside the area, as the successor to the recently destroyed paranormal enclave of Ireta K'éri (formerly FP-71).

The existance of the settlment of Ireta Sapi initially raised security concerns, due to it providing a safe haven for anomalous fugitives pursued by both the Foundation and the Mexican government. However, reporting by the [[[wandsmen-hub| Wandsman]]] as well as diffusion of information through FP-99 (The Net) gained Ireta Sapi considerable support from the international anomalous community, including the [[[manna-charitable-foundation-hub|Manna Charitative Foundation]]] and [[[wilson-s-wildlife-solutions-hub|Wilson's Wildlife Solutions]]], as well as other Free Ports and paranormal enclaves, particularly [[[three-portlands-hub|Three Portlands]]]. Ireta Sapi has been granted provisional Free Port status by the Foundation, allowing it to continue to operate as an autonomous community.

[[# adytum]]
[[div class="blockquote"]]
++ [[span style="font-family: Verdana; font-size: 125%;"]][[[sarkicism-hub|Adytum]]][[/span]]

[[f>image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/scp-2815/Adytumsmall.png width="200px"]]

**Location:** Northern Urals, Western Siberia, Russia (Formerly)

**Description:** Adytum[[footnote]] Greek transliteration of the [[[old-adytite-language|Adytite term]]] //Adí-üm//. Not to be confused with adytum, meaning innermost sanctuary.[[/footnote]] was the capital of the ancient //Kalmaktama// Empire (Adi-um Empire), and is believed to have been located in Western Siberia, now part of Russia. The empire was established in 1,800 BCE by a successful rebellion against the [[[daevite-hub|Daevite civilisation]]], lead by a man known as Grand Karcist Ion. For the next 800 years the city flourished as the center of a new civilization, with grand structures built from organic material through the practice of carnomancy. However, after an ancient [[[scp-2406|Occult War]]] between the //Kalmaktama// Empire and various Mediterranean states, incuding the [[[church-of-the-broken-god-hub|Mekhanites]]], Adytum disappeared from the baseline reality along with Grand Karcist Ion, resulting in the collapse of the //Kalmaktama// civilization and the dispersal of a Sarkic diaspora throughout the world.

The current location and status of Adytum are unclear. Minimal archeological evidence for its existence has been found, although given the organic nature of Sarkic structures and tools, this is not unexpected. Various Sarkic sects believe that Adytum still exists somewhere in the void outside the universe, and some accounts suggest it may still be accessible. Multiple Proto-Sarkic sources claim that the city was deliberately removed from baseline reality, although it is unclear if this was intended to protect the city from invaders, or to prevent something within the city from entering into our reality. Several neo-Sarkic sects are actively working toward the rediscovery and [[[scp-2480|return of Adytum]]], an event that would represent a severe disruption to normalcy, and is to be prevented at all costs.

**Description:**  Although an entrance located in the Tower of London is contained as part of [[[SCP-2264]]],  the extradimensional city-state of Alagadda is not controlled by the Foundation, but is instead ruled by a powerful reality-bending entity known as the [[[divine-dossier#hanged-king| Hanged King]]]. The are many other entrances to Alagadda, some connecting to universes other than our own. Within the city itself, architecture is non-euclidean, the direction of gravity is variable, and the only colors that occur are black, white, yellow, and red. Expeditions into Alagadda have also reported the replacement of all clothing with costumes appropriate for a masquerade ball, the inability to bring back any objects, and difficulty in estimating the passage of time. Further exploration has been put on hold, following violent opposition from the city's ruler.

**Location:** Southern Arabian Desert

**Description:** [[[rounderhouse-gold-proposal| SCP-001]]] is the ancient Mekhanite city of Amoni-Ram, ruined and abandoned around 2600 BCE. The city is concealed within an extradimensional "bubble", preventing any individual without prior knowledge of its location from finding it. Although referred to in the Quran as "Iram of the Pillars", the location of the city was not identified until directions to it were provided by [[[SCP-1867]]], leading to its rediscovery by a Foundation expedition.

The leaders of this expedition, Doctor Robert Aram and Doctor Hedvig Nussbaum, subsequently went rogue, relocating the city through anomalous means to prevent further Foundation access. For more information on the religious movement lead by Robert Aram (AKA Robert Bumaro), refer to Foundation files on the [[[church-of-the-broken-god-hub| Church of the Broken God]]].

**Description:** A small crevasse in a remote region of Antarctica leads to Universe B-10208-Alpha-1483, an alternate reality in which Antarctica is a more temperate region inhabited by sapient hominids known as //Homo antarcticus//. The majority of //Homo antarcticus//, known as “The Summer Court”, are visually similar to baseline humanity, but additional subspecies such as "The Black Court" have many more anatomical and physiological differences. This universe's level of technological advancement is roughly equivalent to our own, with more advanced nuclear, geothermal, and solar power, but more primitive communication and aerospace technologies. The continent is unified under the Third Antarctic Empire, a matriarchal imperialist monarchy founded in 1526 CE. The Foundation is currently engaged in establishing a diplomatic relationship with the Empire, facilitating cross-cultural exchange of knowledge and technology.

[[# confederate-island]]
[[div class="blockquote"]]
++ [[span style="font-family: Verdana; font-size: 125%;"]][[[http://scp-int.wikidot.com/groups-of-interest-jp|Confederate Island Countries of Phantom]]][[/span]]

[[f>image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/locations-of-interest/CICP.png width="150px"]]

**Accessible From:** Baseline, Multiverse

**Description:** The Confederate Island Countries of Phantom (CICP) is a federated nation of islands that exist in a different world. The member islands existed in our world until around the 14th to the 16th century, but relocated through anomalous means to another world, in part to avoid investigation and colonization by the great powers of the time. This resulted in the disappearance of a number of so-called "phantom island", previously documented on nautical charts but unable to be relocated by later expeditions. In the world of the CICP, there are a group of unusual items called "relics", and especially powerful items are called with the initials of T or 丁 and are used for the defense of the member islands. The movement of the member islands out of this world was also made possible by relics, said to have been given by a paranormal civilization known as Thule. Thule is said to have disappeared after the formation of the CICP, and no details of it are known to the inhabitants of the member islands. Travel between our reality and the world of the CICP remains possible, and has been the source of a number of anomalies, some of them dangerous and destructive.

**Associated Articles:**

[[# new-finnfolkaheem]]
[[div class="blockquote"]]
++ [[span style="font-family: Verdana; font-size: 125%;"]]New Finnfolkaheem[[/span]]

**Description:** [[[SCP-4700]]] is the designation assigned to several large-scale submersible vehicles under the joint Foundation-Finnfolk command of Operation HIGH TIDE. Currently, only SCP-4700-1 is complete, and is referred to by the Finnfolk as Finnfolkaheem, or alternatively as Guð-Bani (The God-Slayer). It consists of two components: SCP-4700-1-A, a 5 km wide paratechnological "hermit-crab" armed with advanced weapons systems and concealment technology, and SCP-4700-1-B, a crystalline shell containing a vast extradimensional space. A series of nested cylinders have been constructed inside SCP-4700-1-B, 60 km long and 60 km in diameter, creating multiple environments intended for habitation by the Finnfolk, a species of scaled amphibious hominids.

At time of discovery SCP-4700-1-B was overrun by hostile anomalous entities, including [[[SCP-3456]]]. Control over the location was reestablished by the combined efforts of the Foundation and the Finnfolk. Under the terms of the Foundation-Finnfolk Cooperative Agreement, the Finnfolk (Homo aqueous) have been granted permanent asylum aboard SCP-4700-1, and it is currently the largest known Finnfolk settlement.

[[# paramax]]

**Description:** Paramax is a maximum security prison for paranormal criminals. Although built with Foundation and Global Occult Coalition assistance, it is operated as a United States Penitentiary by the FBI's [[[unusual-incidents-unit-hub| Unusual Incidents Unit]]], holding paracriminals from across North America for the duration of their sentences. The prison was built on a slab of granite suspended in an artificial orphan universe half a mile in diameter,  and is only accessible by temporary ways created using thaumatology. Through the use of reality anchors, anti-occult sigils and psionic dampeners, the prison can contain the majority of humanoid anomalies, with specialized countermeasures enabling the maximum security wing to hold even the most powerful mages, reality benders and demigods. Although many attempts have been made, no prisoner has ever successfully escaped from Paramax.

[[# undervegas]]
[[div class="blockquote"]]
++ [[span style="font-family: Verdana; font-size: 125%;"]][[[undervegas-hub|Undervegas]]][[/span]]

[[f>image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/undervegas-hub/Undervegas2.png width="200px" style="background-color:black;"]]

**Location:** Las Vegas, Nevada, USA; The Fourth Circle of Hell

**Surveillance Facility**: [[[secure-facilities-locations|Site-666]]]

**Description:** [[[SCP-7666]]] is a region of space in which the city of Las Vegas overlaps with the Fourth Circle of Hell, the domain of greed. While the Foundation's actions in 1992 were able to anchor Las Vegas to baseline reality, Las Vegas and Hell continue to influence each other. This has resulted in a region of the Fourth Circle resembling a distorted and exaggerated version of Las Vegas, and has also enabled a number of Tartarean-class demonic entities to cross over from this demonic metropolis into Las Vegas. These entities are drawn towards and draw power from alcohol use, sexual intercourse, and gambling, and so it has been deemed impossible to fully exclude them from Las Vegas. Instead, containment of Undervegas involves cooperation with and employment of these Tartarean Entities, to ensure that the general public remains unaware of their presence within the city.

Undervegas is mostly populated by demons of all seven classical sins (i.e. Lust, Greed, Pride, etc.) and is controlled by seven Pit Bosses that each represent one of the seven sins and one of seven estates. The city of Undervegas is split into seven districts or known as estates, each representing a cardinal sin with each estate being controlled by the most powerful demon in that area or at that time, otherwise known as a 'Pit Boss'. The Fourth Estate, or the Moneypit, is the largest of all seven estates which is controlled by Ba'al, the pit boss of that estate.

**Associated Articles:**
* [[[Third Law Hub]]]
* [[[undervegas-hub|Agent Calendar's Undervegas Hub]]]

[[# unlondon]]
[[div class="blockquote"]]
++ [[span style="font-family: Verdana; font-size: 125%;"]]UnLondon[[/span]]

[[f>image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/locations-of-interest/COA-UnLondon.png width="200px"]]

**Location:** London, England, United Kingdom

**Description:** [[[SCP-1678]]] is a reconstruction of the British city of London, located 1 kilometer underground and constructed entirely in a Victorian style. While it is currently only inhabited by a number of bio-mechanical constructs, it appears to have been constructed through anomalous means to serve as a shelter for survivors of an XK-class end-of-the-world event. The suitability of the location as a disaster shelter is currently being assessed by the Foundation, although it is far from being an ideal option.

**Associated Articles:**
* [[[SCP-1678]]] - UnLondon
* [[[The Lord of the Redacted]]]
* [[[Hop On Hop Off]]]
* [[[the-sun-ever-sets-on-the-british-empire|May The Sun Never Set On The British Empire]]]
* [[[project-isorropia|Project Isorropía]]]
[[/div]]

[[# west-korea]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]

++ [[span style="font-family: Verdana; font-size: 125%;"]]Republic of West Korea[[/span]]

**Location:** Yellow Sea, East Asia

**Description:** The Republic of West Korea is a nation formerly situated on a landmass in the Yellow Sea, west of and presumably connected to the Korean peninsula. Following an engineered reality-altering event, the entirety of the country and its geographical boundaries were displaced from consensus reality, leaving behind only [[[SCP-5345]]]. Analysis of documents recovered from SCP-5345 corroborate the existence of a competent national normalcy organization, the West Korean Ministry of Abnormal Affairs, which was primarily responsible for the nation's disappearance.

While it is possible to access the Republic of West Korea by traversing to its current plane of existence -- believed to be one of many potential afterlives -- or [[[SCP-7722|vice versa]]], the presence of unidentified hostile entities haunting the nation's extraplanar territory have prompted the Foundation's current policy of non-invasive monitoring. There are currently no proposals to make contact with the Republic of West Korea, or restore it to baseline reality.

**Associated Articles:**

* [[[SCP-3812]]] - A Voice Behind Me
* [[[SCP-5345]]] - Almost Heaven, West Korea
* [[[SCP-7722]]] - Nyctopolis

[[/div]]

[[tab About this Page]]
This page compiles a list of settings that have been used within the SCP Universe, places for readers to explore and for writers to utilize in their own work. Note that their coexistence on this page does not mean they necessarily coexist in-universe! Also note that different depictions of a location may differ, there's nothing incorrect about changing some of the details to better fit the story you intend to tell.

Nexuses were originally defined on the [[[nexus-series|Nexus Hub]]] as a specific type of article format, although over time various locations were added to the page that were described as Nexuses in SCPs and Tales. Free Ports were added later, as another type of anomalous location. When working on this rewrite, we decided to include a number of additional "Locations of Interest" that appeared in multiple articles, but weren't officially defined as a Nexus or Free Port, and while creating this page we've avoided referring to them as such in the absence of an official classification in a published article without first getting the author's permission to assign a Free Port number. Some anomalous locations will be been omitted from the list above - they either don't have at least 2 appearances in published articles, or they simply haven't been added to the page yet.

The map is the best representation we can manage of where the Locations shown on it are, or at least where they are accessible from, in the case of locations within pocket dimensions or alternate realities. Although it was created using the same map as the [[[secure-facilities-locations|Facilities page]]], created by [[*user L200]], it was inspired by earlier work by IAmPuzzlr, [https://www.reddit.com/r/SCP/comments/pzugc5/another_guide_poster_for_your_rooms_this_time_for/ posted on reddit].

The images used here are a mixture of flags, coats of arms, signs and logos -- anything that can represent a place. Not all locations have one, and people are welcome to create more. Some existed already, while others were created specifically to be included on this page -- feel free to use them elsewhere!
[[/tab]]
[[tab Adding to this Page]]
This collaborative page is open for any site member to edit and add to, but you're welcome to make suggestions or get feedback on proposed additions in the Discussion. In general, the idea was to be as inclusive as possible within the general scope of "inhabited anomalous location".

Anyone is welcome to add to the list of articles in which a location appears or is described, although we're looking for more than just a brief mention. If there is a tag, please limit the appearances to no more than the 5, prioritising the most relevant or most informative articles.

This page is the responsibility of the [http://05command.wikidot.com/curation-main Curation Team]. If you have any questions or suggestions, you can contact us via the #help-desk channel on the [https://discord.com/invite/scp SCP Wiki Official Discord server], or via [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/chat-guide IRC chat #site17], or by messaging a member of the Collaboration Pages subteam. 

++ Adding New Locations

The first section of this page is for all locations described in a [[[nexus-series|Nexus format]]]. Additional locations that are referred to as a Nexus within an SCP or Tale can be added, as long as they're given a number and described in sufficient detail to enable their inclusion here. Merely mentioning the name and Nexus number is insufficient, although there is a list of those on [[[locations-complete-list| this page]]]. International articles using a non-standard format will be added to the list at the appropriate place numerically if articles are translated, treating Nx-CN-08 as equivalent to Nx-08.

Free Ports don't have a specified format in exactly the same way, but will generally be treated the same as just another type of Nexus -- if the Free Port number appears in a published article, it can be included in the list.

For Locations of Interest, we're looking for a minimum of 2 appearances -- otherwise we'd end up listing every SCP with the [/system:page-tags/tag/location location] and [/system:page-tags/tag/city city] tags, and we want to keep the length of this page manageable. To count as an appearance, we're looking for more than just the mention of the name -- part of the story should focus on or take place in the Location of Interest. Additionally, a Location of Interest must be a place that can actually be visited in-universe, not somewhere that used to exist but no longer does (unless, for example, the ruins of it remain interesting). For an alternate reality to count as a Location of Interest, there will need to be a reliable way for people to travel there, as well as some way of communicating information about it back. 

[[collapsible show="Template for new additions" hide="Omit any section that's not applicable!"]]
[[code]]
[[# table-of-contents-anchor]]
[[div class="blockquote"]]
++ [[span style="font-family: Verdana; font-size: 125%;"]]Nx-XX: Nexus Name[[/span]]

[[f>image image-url height="150px"]] [!--(or width="200px")--]

**Area Class:** ##blue|**Briar**##/##green|**Asphodel**##/##FFDD00|**Camelot**##/ ##orange|**Shangri-La**##/##red|**Dunwich**##/##purple|**Free Port**##

**Location:**/**Accessible From:** City, State, Country [!--Can list more than one, but don't list more than 4--]

**Containment Facility:**/**Surveillance Facility:** Site-YY

**Description:** About the Location [!--Write from the perspective of the Foundation--]

**Associated Articles:**
* [[[link|Title]]] [!--If there's a tag, limit it to 5 articles, then link the tag as the last one. --]
[[/div]]
[[/code]]
[[/collapsible]]

++ Adding to the Map
If a Location is added to this list, it can also be added to the map, to indicate the general area it's located in or accessible from. Instructions for doing this can be found on the [[[fragment:locations-map|page where the map is hosted]]].

++ Adding New Images
New images to represent specific locations can be added to the page, but before uploading them it's best to get feedback from the creator of the location, or at least from someone who's written articles featuring the location. While there's flexibility on size since the proportions of these images vary, as a general rule the height should not be more than 150px, and the width should not be more than 200px. To keep things consistent, for flags and other wide images set width="200px", while for coats of arms, seals and other round or square logos, set height="150px".

[[/tab]]

[[tab Nexus Format]]
A Nexus is defined as an actively anomalous area that supports a permanent community. When creating a new Nexus, keep the following characteristics in mind.

++ Low Population
Most Nexuses have very low population numbers, generally with only a few thousand people. A large population would make it much harder for their existence to be concealed by the Foundation, as news of the Nexus's existence would spread much more easily.

++ Nexus Confines
A Nexus's anomalies only occur within the confines of the Nexus (or in certain cases, other Nexuses). For example, you couldn't force the Goatman from Sloth's Pit to exit the confines of the Nexus: the act would simply make him a normal goat after a while. What happens in the Nexus, stays in the Nexus.

++ Thematic Influence
Each Nexus has its central theme that encompasses the entire idea of the anomaly in the Nexus. They can exist anywhere in the world, so long as they have around ~25 people at least, and should not match any real-world location. Besides that, you're free to do whatever you want. If you want a Nexus that rains salmon, go ahead[[footnote]]Someone's already done that idea, unfortunately[[/footnote]].

++ The Nexus Format

To create a new Nexus Article, copy the following template:

[[code]]

[[>]]
[[module Rate]]
[[/>]]

**Nexus #:** Nx-XX

**Civilian Designation:** [Name of Nexus Town]

**Population:** [Approximate number of people living in the Nexus]

**Area Class:** Briar/Asphodel/Camelot/Shangri-La/Dunwich (indicate which class)

**Nexus Interaction Protocol:** [Paragraphs explaining special requirements for personnel working in the Nexus]

**Containment Facility:** [Optional Site/Area dedicated to containment and monitoring]

**Description:** [Paragraphs describing the Nexus]

**Addendum:** [Optional additional paragraphs]

[[/code]]
[[/tab]]

[[/tab]]
